page.title: 02A Church In Felixstowe
page.content: The church of St Peter and Paul is the {oldest building}in Felixstowe. In about{1100}Roger Bigod built a Benedictine Priory here dedicated to St Felix. Many bits have been added since the 14th century. Before the reformation the church was full of colour and wealth, but in the 16th & 17th centuries the interior was altered according to the new beliefs. Early in the 19th century the church was left neglected. The second half of the 19th century saw dramatic changes in both church and village. This was because Felixstowe became fashionable as a watering place and there was an interest in the restoration of churches. The church is made of{septaria}a local building material. It's total length is 126 feet.
